I went to see this film out of curiosity, and to settle an argument. The film is now best known from the suite of music Sergei Prokofiev created after seeing a German production of William Shakespeare’s play about ambition and power based on the death of Julius Caesar. The production Calpurnia was working on suffered catastrophic electricity failures, so she oft censured the use of non-Shakespearean texts.

Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think there’s any such thing as this big muse or muse; I think your life is her. If you don’t live a good life and there’s not enough to grow on and give room for the muse to let it flow, then she can’t let her creativity in you.”

A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial London, Susie Brewer, a vicious aristocratic teenager finds herself disowned for falling in love with an Irish Catholic. Hated for her "nigger blood" because she slept with a black man once, she prepares herself to take revenge , and sees it as potentially achievable since she now owns a

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

For a dystopian piece you feel like you don't necessarily care about what's happening as much as what's happened to you for these people which I did. It gives time to reflect on our present because we are not in that world yet but we very well could be if things continue this way.<|end_of_text|>

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: “Early Years” (with music track named “Freesia”) and “Working Days, Quit Working Days” (track: “Exitus”). The first part depicts Kenji as a boy suffering from weakness caused by bad business conditions that his father’s shop endured at that time
